page.title: 17DEEPING ST.JAMES PRIORY FARM
page.content: Priory Farm is an arable farm.This year the crops are 195 acres of winter wheat,20 acres of winter barley,18 acres of spring barley,63 acres of winter oil seed rape,20 acres of peas, 35 acres of tick beans.Lupins are a new crop this year. They are being grown for cattle feed. The farmer grows the same crops every year.He doesn't think he will grow lupins again as it wasn't a very good crop in the trial run he had this year.He mainly sells all his crop to two merchants who come and look at it in the field and then will give a price.If the farmer doesn't think he will get a higher price later on in the month he sells it straight away to the merchant.One of the merchants sends the wheat to Boston Docks to be sent abroad. Another buys the peas for cattle feed.
